intro: Dimorphocalyx ovalis, commonly known as the oval-leaved dimorphocalyx, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds.
